overview:
## Discussion

Group rows are rows for which the table view delegate’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableViewDelegate/tableView(_:isGroupRow:)] method returns YES. These rows can be displayed as if they are floating in a view-based table view.

The default value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true].

# floatsGroupRows

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value indicating whether the table view draws grouped rows as if they are floating.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var floatsGroupRows: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

Group rows are rows for which the table view delegate’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableViewDelegate/tableView(_:isGroupRow:)] method returns YES. These rows can be displayed as if they are floating in a view-based table view.

The default value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true].
title: floatsGroupRows
